Лучшая игра в своём роде.

This is the most metal game ever. The gameplay is simple, the survivors need to get 5 generators  and an escape lever to survive, and the killer tries to kill them all before they can get out. That's the entire game. BUT, I've found the best thing is playing the game and collecting the narratives. The stories that unlock as you complete challenges are what makes the game challenging, repeatable, and keeps you on your toes. This game also requires a very high level of understanding of perks, add-ons (not your WoW add-ons), and strategy. I see this game surviving even if every Killer in the game came after the developers.
Um jogo bem legal e divertido de jogar com uma variedade de perks, killers, e survivors. O pouco q joguei eu amei. Recomendo.

could be better with how toxic the community is, but it doesn't matter if you just get good at the game :)

Es, y probablemente seguirá siendo, mi juego multijugador favorito de todos los tiempos. Jugué a ambos, sobreviviente y asesino, y personalmente prefiero el lado de sobreviviente. La duración de los partidos es bastante decente, puede tomar hasta 25 minutos como máximo y 5 si tienes compañeros de equipo suicidas. El juego se actualiza con frecuencia y recibe un nuevo dlc generalmente cada 3 meses con un nuevo sobreviviente y asesino. También tiene una gran variedad de pieles que puedes conseguir con fragmentos azules jugando, desde las grietas o con células áuricas (dinero). Sí, la jugabilidad es un poco repetitiva, pero hay muchas misiones de temporada que hacen que no te concentres siempre en la misma jugabilidad habitual, para que no te aburras y te recompense con una cantidad decente de puntos y máscaras en cada nivel. arriba.

Antes de empezar quiero aclarar que nada más estoy dando mi punto de vista, mi opinión, mi forma de pensar sobre este juego, bajo ningún concepto mi intención es ofender a nadie, les recuerdo que esto está basado plenamente de mano de mi experiencia con este juego. Una vez dicho esto puedo comenzar, yo opino que
I love everything about this game, I just moved to pc after 500+ hours on console. the only thing I don't like is that killer queue times are very long, 4+ minutes per game

Fun for a while, but past the fun there's an endless well of toxicity and elitism that you come across with randoms or even with friends. A good experience when you don't know much about the game and there's a level of the unexpected. Once you come across either toxic killers hook camping you, randoms calling you a retard for not sacrificing yourself for them, or friends not caring about fun/creativity and only going for meta builds, just quit. Regret. Uninstall.
Literally the most mentally straining game I've ever played. 10/10, became an eggheaded, shirtless, buff guy from europe who throws pebbles and is unable to scream.

This game is big fun. Its fun to play by myself, and its fun to play with friends. I have two problems with the game however, hit-boxes, and the matchmaking system. Sometimes I will see the knife hit a survivor and they won't go down or into the injured state, and often times I will get matched with players that are several ranks higher or lower than me, and it either makes the game too difficult or too easy. Also, rank one people will derank and fucking annihilate you. Its very annoying. Other than that though, the game is a blast, and I highly recommend it to anyone that likes horror games/movies, or liked Friday the 13th or deceit.

okay, you know how people refuse to leave toxic relationships bc they hope the other person will change? that's dead by daylight.
it's great at first, you fall in love, and then the cracks start to appear. and you want nothing more than for bhvr to make the necessary fixes so that it can go back to being great. but we all know that that's never going to happen.
but we're still here anyway.

Owned this game since a couple months after it was first released back in June 2016 and I'm very pleased with development of this game over the years. It has gone from a game which was virtually unplayable due to awful balancing issues and bugs (but still super fun to play) to a much more refined, far less buggy and balanced game. 

I highly recommend purchasing this game with a couple of friends. The multiplayer survivor experience is unbelievably fun, as well as the solo killer experience.

Note for new players:

While this game can create a lot of toxicity, it is important to remember that while you play either survivor or killer that this is a casual game and shouldn't be treated competitively. You will get camped, tunnelled and slugged as a survivor from time to time, this is apart of the game and you should not bother you, there are plenty of streamers and youtubers which provide great tactics for you avoid these I recommend watching some play. As for killer, survivors will sometimes give you a rough time, it is important once again to understand that this is part of game and not to get to let it bother you. There is nearly always a counterplay. 

If you do end up purchasing this game, have fun in the fog.

Although the community is split between sweaty tryhards, twitchies, newbs, noobs, middle players, and pro gamers, the game is truly fun! It offers a different experience every game and really never gets boring. I really do enjoy this game! Sure, it has it's problems, but overall a great game! Highly recommend this game and all it has to offer! I hope you found this review helpful! Happy gaming!
